Title: More than 145 Reports Added to IAEA Incident and Trafficking Data...
Description: In 2024, 147 incidents of illegal or unauthorized activities involving nuclear and other radioactive material were reported to the Incident and Trafficking Database, a number aligned with the historical average.

Title: Update 278 – IAEA Director General Statement on Situation in Ukra...
Description: Two weeks after it was hit by a drone, Ukrainian firefighters are still trying to extinguish smouldering fires within the large structure built over the reactor destroyed in the 1986 Chornobyl nuclear accident, Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said today.

Title: What are Radiopharmaceuticals?
Description: Radiopharmaceuticals are used in nuclear medicine worldwide. Their applications range from imaging of many different organs, such as brain, heart, kidney and bone, to the treatment of cancer and hyperthyroidism.

Title: IAEA Profile: A Woman’s Mission to Advance Nuclear Information Ma...
Description: Dibuleng Mohlakwana and her team are introducing innovative tools and techniques to improve how the IAEA shares, organizes and makes its collection of nuclear information accessible.

Title: IAEA Team Concludes Site and External Events Design Review for Gh...
Description: An IAEA team of experts has concluded an eight-day safety review of Ghana’s site selection process for its first nuclear power plant. Ghana is pursuing the introduction of nuclear power to increase its low carbon power production to meet energy demand, tackle climate change and increase energy security and diversity.

Title: Director General in Japan Supporting Nuclear Safety and Remediati...
Description: The IAEA Director General has been in Japan this week, supporting local efforts to enhance nuclear safety and environmental remediation, as the country prepares to restart its nuclear power plants closed since the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear accident.

Title: Strengthening New Partnership with Japanese Private Sector
Description: The IAEA Director General has signed a cooperation agreement with one of the largest worldwide integrated trading companies and had a lecture and networking event at Keidanren (Japan Business Federation) this week, as part of ongoing efforts to promote the peaceful uses of nuclear energy through partnerships.

Title: Update 277 – IAEA Director General Statement on Situation in Ukra...
Description: Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhya Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP) has been relying on a single off-site power line for more than a week now after its only remaining back-up line was lost, once again highlighting an extremely fragile nuclear safety situation during the military conflict, Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said today.

Title: IAEA Completes Integrated Safety Assessment Mission for Bolivia's...
Description: An IAEA team of experts said that the Agency for Nuclear Energy of Bolivia, operator of Bolivia's first nuclear research reactor that is under construction, has developed a management system implementing the IAEA's safety standards.

Title: IAEA Director General Joins International Experts for Seawater Sa...
Description: IAEA Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi joined scientists from the People’s Republic of China, the Republic of Korea, and Switzerland, along with IAEA experts, as they collected seawater samples near the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power station today.

Title: IAEA to Host International Symposium on AI and Nuclear Energy in ...
Description: The IAEA will host the first ever International Symposium on Artificial Intelligence and Nuclear Energy at its headquarters in Vienna from 3 to 4 December 2025.

Title: Recycling old Radium into Cancer Drugs
Description: An IAEA expert mission was deployed to Suva, Fiji, to support the recovery and transportation of radium-226 transport to the USA, where the sources will be used as a feedstock to produce actinium-225, an alpha-emitting isotope which is increasingly used in targeted cancer treatments.
